instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message:
This machine doesn't appear to have any liquid damage and the customer says no sound works on here but it does work with bluetooth audio. No ouput or input devices are detected on the sound page. I have done an SMC and PRAM reset but that didn't fix the issue.

I tried shorting pins 1 and 2 of the headphone socket to see if that would fix the issue as it worked on a previous machine I had with a similar issue but that didn't solve this issue.
I checked the voltages on L6607/8 with a headphone plugged in. With no headphone plugged in I get 0v on both.
L6607 - 0.10v
L6608 - 0.37v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: check voltages for audio codec, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP4V5_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL>...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL> - 3.25v
<SIGNAL>PP4V5_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL> - fluctuating quickly from between 1.31v to 1.49v.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_AUDIO_AMP_L</SIGNAL> - 5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_AUDIO_XW</SIGNAL> - 4.94v

L6200/1 both have correct voltages on both sides of them.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message:
Update: I just touched the <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> chip after turning the machine on and it gets extremely hot so I will have to replace this chip. I see this is a BGA chip and I don't have a stencil to reball one from a donor nor am I good at reballing these chips.

Do you know of a trick or easier way to replace this chip?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message:
Chip is like $10.00 
[url]https://www.ebay.com/itm/Lot-of-Cirrus-CS4208-CRZR-CS4208-CRZR-Power-IC-Chipset-With-Solder-Balls-/331738442024[/url]

in a pickle i'd just re-ball by hand, 30 mins tops.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: How do you reball it by hand without a stencil? I manually put solder balls on each pad of a donor chip and as soon as I put even the smallest amount of hot air near it the solder balls slid off the pads.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: I reball with universal stencil and just pick off the unused balls after reflow.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: Do you have a link to where I can purchase this stencil you use and what size solder balls are best for this chip.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: [url]https://www.ebay.com/itm/80-80-0-25mm-0-25-mm-Pitch-0-5mm-BGA-Reball-Universal-Stencil-Template/401200458144[/url]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message:
Okay I replaced <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> and now I get a chime through the speakers but when I login to the OS there is no sound through speakers and it stays on "digital output". If I plug in headphones it switches to headphones and i can hear sound through them but when I unplug the headphones it goes back to digital optical output.

I'm not sure if this is due to a chip not being on correctly but I think I soldered it on on correctly as I've done plenty of <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>'s but I have 1 more of these chips left so I don't want to use it yet if that isn't even the issue.
I measured <RESISTOR>R6324</RESISTOR> and it was only showing .22v on both sides even though the resistance measured fine. I replaced it along with <RESISTOR>R6323</RESISTOR>/ <RESISTOR>R6332</RESISTOR> and now I get 3.3v on both sides of <RESISTOR>R6324</RESISTOR>.

I also tried shorting pins 1 & 2 of the headphone socket to see if that would work as it did on a similar issue I had in the past but that didn't work either.

I get 0v on both sides on L6607/08 with and without headphones plugged in. Diode mode of L6607 is 1.09v and on L6608 it is 0.61v

I did a reflow on the <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> chip but that didn't fix this. Also, I am getting a red light appearing from the headphone jack.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: Try another I/O board...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: I've been doing these tests without the I/O Board plugged in. Does that board matter on these Retina Macbook Pro's?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: wow, so sorry, i was confused, this could be a bad headphone jack, also inspect for ripped components around headphone jack...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: I don't see any damaged components around the headphone jack but is there any way I can check if the headphone jack is the issue without removing it?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: L6604 and L6608 are connected together, check on diode mode. Also check diode mode to GND on L6607/08.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message:
Not sure what you were asking in the first part but there is continuity from L6604 to L6608. In diode mode both L6604/08 were 0.61v 
Diode mode of L6607 is 1.09v and on L6608 it is 0.61v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message:
[USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER] [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]

Any other ideas on this or should I just go ahead and replace the headphone jack?

Update: I removed both L6607/08 to see if that would fix this but that didn't solve the issue. I went ahead and just removed the headphone jack but that didn't fix the issue either.
Could it just be an issue with the <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> chip I put on?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message:
Is there anything else I can check for on this before I try replacing <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> again?

I'm not very familiar with audio circuit and I can't find much information on the web on this similar issue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message:
Removing the headphone jack will CAUSE this issue, put all that stuff back.

Voltages on L6604/08?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message:
I put another headphone jack on as well as L6607/08 and the issue still remains. I still get sound when I plug in headphones.

I get 0v on L6604/08 and L6607
Diode mode reading of L6607 and L6608 is 0.597 & 1.17v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: To rule out the jack and protection diodes remove L6604 and 6608 and connect both pin 1 of them together. See if there is speaker audio now in OSX.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: Okay I did that and still no speaker audio in OSX.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message:
I hoping I can get this fixed soon. I took these measurements again and here is what I got.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL> - 3.25v
<SIGNAL>PP4V5_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL> - 4.5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_AUDIO_AMP_L</SIGNAL> - 5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_AUDIO_XW</SIGNAL> - 5v
L6200 - 5v on both sides

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message: I don't know anymore. Replace all the DZ660x protection diode at the audio jack. Measure voltages on <SIGNAL>TIPDET_1</SIGNAL> and 2 and compare to working board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio output or input - bluetooth sound works
threads.message:
wow I wish I would have tried this much earlier but after replacing all the protection diodes this issue was fixed.

Thanks a lot duke.
